comments.author: m_kato@ga2.so-net.ne.jp
comments.text:
As long as I test on Win64 PGO with VC9 x64, it is unnecessary to hack for bug 640494.  It should be on MSVC x86 only.

Win64 build uses VC9SP1 on tinderbox.
comments.creator: m_kato@ga2.so-net.ne.jp
comments.raw_text:
As long as I test on Win64 PGO with VC9 x64, it is unnecessary to hack for bug 640494.  It should be on MSVC x86 only.

Win64 build uses VC9SP1 on tinderbox.
Are you aware there's bug 653322, already?
comments.creator: mh+mozilla@glandium.org
comments.text: Are you aware there's bug 653322, already?

comments.author: mh+mozilla@glandium.org
comments.text: Note that this is most likely a compiler problem, so even x86 VC9 might be working. I'm trying to get a local build off x86 VC8sp1, but that it fails to link xul.lib in the first pass...
comments.creator: mh+mozilla@glandium.org
comments.raw_text: Note that this is most likely a compiler problem, so even x86 VC9 might be working. I'm trying to get a local build off x86 VC8sp1, but that it fails to link xul.lib in the first pass...

comments.text:
(In reply to comment #4)
> Note that this is most likely a compiler problem, so even x86 VC9 might be
> working. I'm trying to get a local build off x86 VC8sp1, but that it fails to
> link xul.lib in the first pass...

Although I don't test on VC9SP1 x86, should I test using VC9SP1 x86?
PGO compiler sometimes generates incorrect code if using MMX, SSE and FP (such as bug 413019).
comments.author: m_kato@ga2.so-net.ne.jp
comments.creator: m_kato@ga2.so-net.ne.jp
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to comment #4)
> Note that this is most likely a compiler problem, so even x86 VC9 might be
> working. I'm trying to get a local build off x86 VC8sp1, but that it fails to
> link xul.lib in the first pass...

Although I don't test on VC9SP1 x86, should I test using VC9SP1 x86?
PGO compiler sometimes generates incorrect code if using MMX, SSE and FP (such as bug 413019).

comments.creator: m_kato@ga2.so-net.ne.jp
comments.text: Also, as long as I know, we have a plan to switch to VC10 if Bug 515492 is fixed.  (VC10 has no build-able CRT code.)  So it may be unnecessary to test VC9SP1 x86.
comments.author: m_kato@ga2.so-net.ne.jp
comments.raw_text: Also, as long as I know, we have a plan to switch to VC10 if Bug 515492 is fixed.  (VC10 has no build-able CRT code.)  So it may be unnecessary to test VC9SP1 x86.
